briefTitle: Magnesium Versus Prochlorperazine Versus Metoclopramide for Migraines

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age \> 18 years or older
* Able to provide informed consent
* Primary diagnosis of headache or migraine
* Between October 1, 2018 to April 1, 2020
* Presenting to Advocate Christ Medical Center emergency department and meet clinical assessment per physician

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnancy defined as a positive urine HCG
* Stated history of renal impairment
* Allergy or sensitivity to any study drugs
* Concomitant treatment at the time of study drug administered in the emergency department
* Patients with a history of this study participation

outcomeMeasures.title: 30 Minute Pain Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Scores range from 0-10. A higher score, denotes more pain

outcomeMeasures.title: Length of Stay
outcomeMeasures.description: Emergency Department Length of stay. Measured from time of arrival to time of discharged documented in the electronic medical record.

outcomeMeasures.title: Need for Rescue Analgesia
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of participants who had necessity for rescue analgesics after study drug administration
